msItem.title: Portions of a Service-book, containing the Order of the Resurrection, in eight parts.
msItem.rubric: ܥܠ ܣܒܪܐ ܕܠܗܐ (sic) ܟܬܒܝܢܢ ܛܟܣܐ ܕܩ̈ܠܐ ܕܩܝܡܝܬܐ (sic) ܩܕܝܫܬܐ

msItem.title: The fourth order
The seventh order
The eighth order
Part d

item.p: Seventeen paper leaves, about 14 5/8 in. by 10 5/8, nearly all more or less stained and torn. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 22 to 25 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of the xiiith cent.

msItem.note: The division of the services is: ܨܠܘܬܐ, ܦܪܘܡܝܘܢ, ܣܕܪܐ, ܥܛܪܐ, and ܚܘܬܡܐ.

The Epiphany

item.p: A paper leaf, 13 in. by 9 ½ , much torn. The pages are divided into two columns of 28 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of the xiiith cent.

msItem.title: Part of a Jacobite Lectionary from the Gospels for the Sundays and Festivals of the whole year
msItem.rubric: [ܒܫܡܐ ܕܬܠܝܬܝܘܬܐ ܣܓܝܕܬܐ ܘܫܘ]ܝ̣ܬ݀ ܒܐܘܣ̣ܝܐ̣ ܕ[ܐܒܐ ܘ]ܕܒ[ܪܐ ܘܕܪܘܚܐ ܩܕܝ]ܫܐ ܚܕ ܐܠܗܐ ܫܪܝ[ܪܐ: ܡـ]ܫܪܝܢܢ ܕܢܟܬ݂ܘܒ ܟܬܒ̣ܐ ܕܐܘܢܓܠܝ̣ܘܢ ܣܓܝ̣ܕܐ: [ܦ]ܘܪܫ ܩܪ̈ܝܢܐ ܕܚܘܕܪܐ ܕܟܠܗ̇ ܫ̇ܢ̣ܬܐ ܥܐܕܐ ܒܬܪ ܥܐܕܐ ܘܚܕܒܫܒܐ [ܒ]ܬܪ ܚܕܒܫܒܐ ܕܡܟ̣̈ܢܫ ܡܢ ܐܪ̈ܒܥܐ ܐܘܓܠܝ̣ܣ̈ܛܐ ܕܠܐ ܒܘܨܪܐ ܘܠܐ [ܬܘ]ܣ̣ܦܬܐ: ܐܝܟ ܬܚܘܼܡܐ ܕܡܛܟܲܣ ܡܢ ܐܒܗ̈ܬܐ ܩܕ̈ܝܫܐ ܕܡܬܝܕܥ ܟܠ [ܐ]ܝܢܐ ܡܢ ܚܒ̣ܪܗ ܏ܩܕܡܐܝܬ ܡܬܝ ܏ܡܪܩܘܣ ܠܘܩܐ ܏ܝܘܚܢܢ.

msItem.title: The Consecration of the Church
The Annunciation of Zacharias
The Annunciation of the blessed Virgin
The Visit of Mary to Elisabeth
The Nativity of S. John the Baptist

item.p: Three paper leaves, about 10 5/8 in. by 7 1/8, all more or less stained and torn (Add. 17,224, foll. 19—21). Each page is divided into two columns, of from 25 to 31 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of the xiiith or xivth cent., with occasional Greek vowels.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue , abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

msItem.title: Part of a Jacobite Lectionary from the Gospels for various occasions
The Nativity of our Lord
Lent
The third week
The fourth week

item.p: Twelve paper leaves, about 12 7/8 in. by 9 7/8, several of which are stained and torn (Add. 17,224, foll. 22—33). Each page is divided into two columns, of from 21 to 25 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of the xiiith cent., with occasional Greek vowels and other points.

item.p: On the margins there are a few grammatical and explanatory notes. E.g., fol. 22 a, S. Luke ii. 8, ܘܢ̇ܛܪܝܢ ܡܰܛܰܪܳܬ݀ܐ ܕܠܠܝܐ ܥܠ ܡ̈ܪܥܝܳܬܗܘܢ On ܡܛܪܬܐ margin: ܒܦܬܚ ܛܝ܏ܬ ܚܕܢܐܝܬ ܏ܘ . . . ܒܰܙܩܦ ܏ܪܝܫ ܣܓܝܐܢܐܝܬ "with pĕthāchā of the tēth as a singular; and (the Nestorians?) with zĕkāphā of the rīsh as a plural." Again, on ܡ̈ܪܥܝܬܗܘܢ, margin: ܚܪܩܠܝܐ ܒܚܒܨ ܏ܥܐ ܚܕܢܐܝܬ "the Harklensian version with chĕbāsā of the ‘ē as a singular." Fol. 24 b, S. Matthew, xiii. 29,ܬܥܩܪܘܢ ܥܡܗܘܢ ܐܦ ܚ̈ܛܐ On ܬܥ̣ܩܪܘܢ , margin ܒܶܪܒܨ ܏ܬܘ ܏ܢܣܛܘܪ̈ ܏ܒܦܬ ܏ܬܘ "with rĕbāsā of the tau, but the Nestorians with pĕthāchā of the tau."

msItem.title: Part of a Nestorian Lectionary from the Gospels
The Epiphany
The first Sunday after the Epiphany

item.p: Two paper leaves, about 12 in. by 9 3/4, both much stained and torn (Add. 17,224, foll. 34, 35). Each page is divided into two columns, of 19 or 20 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is a large Estrangela of the xiith or xiiith cent., with numerous Syriac vowels and other points.

item.p: On the margin of fol. 34 a there is written in a very rude hand:

p.quote: ܟܠܡܢ ܕܩܪܐ ܨܠܐ ܥܠܝܢ ܐܚ̈ܐ ܚ̈ܛܝܐ ܘܐܢܫ̈ܐ ܐܝܬܝ (sic) ܚܢܢ ܡܢ ܐܬܪܐ ܕܡܘܨܠ ܣܘܪ̈ܝܝـ[ܐ]

item.p: On fol. 35 b we find, in the same handwriting, the name of Rabban Behnām

p.quote: ܐܢܐ ܕܘܝܐ ܪܒܢ ܒܗܢܡ ܕܟܬܒ ܗܠܝܢ ܣܘܪ̈ܛܐ

msItem.author: Eusebius of Caesarea
msItem.title: Part of the Epistle of Eusebius to Carpianus, explanatory of the canons
The genealogy of S. Joseph, the husband of the Virgin Mary
A statement of the number of chapters, sections, etc., in the gospels of S. Matthew and S. Mark

item.p: A paper leaf, much mutilated, of the xiiith cent., apparently one of the fly-leaves of a copy of the Gospels.

msItem.title: The Gospel of S. Matthew, according to the Peshitta version.
msItem.note: Contains ch. x. 16—xii. 11, and ch. xii. 14—xiv. 3.

item.p: The first two leaves are much torn.

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns, of from 20 to 23 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of thexiiith cent.

item.p: At the foot of fol. 42b there is written in red ink:

p.quote: ܨܒ̇ܐ ܐܢ̣ܐ ܡܢ ܐܚܐ ܪܚ̇ܡ̣ ܠܡܫܝܚܐ ܕܦܓ݁ܥ ܡ̇ܢ ܒܩ̈ܠܦܐ ܗܠܝܢ܆ ܕܢܨ̇ܠܐ ܥܠ ܕܘܝܐ ܘܡܠܸܐ ܡܘ̈ܡܐ. . . ܐܦ ܠܐ ܫ̇ܘܐ ܐܢܐ. ܐܦ. . .

msItem.title: Fragments of the Gospels, according to the Peshitta version
S. Matthew
S. John

item.p: Most leaves are more or less torn.

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns, of from 14 to 18 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is a large, bold Estrangela, datedA. Gr. 1484,A.D. 1173.See additions.

item.p: At the end there is a note, giving the date and the name of the scribe,David:

p.quote: ܫܠ̣ܡ ܝܘܚܢܢ ܫܠܝ̣ܚܐ. ܒܪܟܡܪܝ. ܝ̣ܨܦ ܘܚܲܕܬ ܐܘܼܢܓܠܝܘܢ̇ ܗܢܐ. ܕܘܝܕ ܏ܕܒܫܡ ܕܝܪܝܐ ܫܢܬ ܏ܐ ܐܠܦ ܏ܘܬ ܘ܏ܦܕ ܕܝܘܢ̈ܝܐ.

item.p: The wordsܫܠ̣ܡ ܝܘܚܢ ܫܠܝ̣ܚܐare written in blue, bordered with red, and the wordܫܠ̣ܡis gilded.

msItem.note: With anArabic translation, in parallel columns.

msItem.title: S. Matthew
S. Mark
msItem.note: Contains ch. xii. 14 and 20, xii. 39—xiv. 13, and xiv. 28—40.

msItem.title: Fragments of the first two Gospels, according to the Peshitta version, in Arabic translation
S. Matthew
S. Mark
msItem.note: Contains ch. xii. 14 and 20, xii. 39—xiv. 13, and xiv. 28—40.

item.p: All leaves are more or less torn.

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns, of from 17 to 26 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of thexiiith cent.

item.p: Lessons are marked on the margins by different hands.

msItem.title: The Gospel of S. Luke, ch. ix. 12—17, according to the Peshitta version.

item.p: This leaf is slightly torn.

handNote.desc: Written in a current hand of about thexiiith cent.

item.p: On the lower margin there is a note, written by oneYeshūa’, the disciple ofJoel(?), stating that the manuscript, of which this leaf formed part, belonged to a monk and priest namedRabban BěrīchāofJerusalem.

p.quote: ܗܢܐ ܟܘܪܣܐ. . . ܒܐ ܠܪܒܢ ܒܪܝܟܐ ܕܝܪܝܐ ܢܟܦܐ. ܏ܘܩܫܝ ܙܗܝܐ. ܕܡܬܝܕܥ ܐܘܪܫܠܡܝܐ. ܘܡܪܝܐ ܢܢܛܪܝܘܗܝ ܐܡܝܢ. ܘܡ̇ܢܛܪ ܠܢ ܡܪܝܐ ܒܨ̈ܠܘܬܗ ܐܡܝܢ. (ܟـ)ܬܒ̣ ܣܘܪ̈ܛܐ ܗܠܝܢ ܝܫܘܥ ܐܟܣܢܝܐ. ܕܡܬܝܕܥ ܬܪܒܝܬܐ ܕܝܝܐܝܠ ܐܠܗܐ ܚܘܢ̣ܝܗܝ.

item.p: Another note, on the outer margin of the same page, and in the same handwriting, refers to the assumption of the monastic garb by the disciple of oneThomas.

p.quote: ܗ̈ܘܝ ܗܠܝܢ ܒܝܘܡ ܚܕܒܫܒܐ ܒ܏ܝܙ ܒܬܫܪܝܢ ܐܚܪܝ. ܘܒܗ̇ܘ ܝܘܡܐ ܠܒ̣ܫ ܬܠܡܝܕܗ ܕܬܐܘܡܐ ܐܣܟܝܡܐ ܕܕܝܪܝܘܬܐ. ܡܢ ܕܝܪܐ ܕܒܡܘܙܐܘܒܙ (?)

handNote.desc: It is written in a current hand of the xith or xiith cent.

msItem.title: A note stating that the volume, to which it belonged, was written by a monk named Mas'ud ibn Kalda ibn Mauhub, of Bartella Castra (بَرْطُلَّي), near Mosul, for Rabban Jum'a
msItem.rubric: ܟܬܒܗ ܕܝܢ ܠܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܡܣܥܘܕ ܡܚܝ̣ܠܐ ܕܒܫܡܐ ܕܝܪܝܐ ܒܪ ܟܠܕܐ ܒܪ ܡܘܗܘܒ ܡܢ ܒܪܛܠܝ ܩܐܣܛܪܐ ܡܫܲܡܗܐ ܕܒܐܬܪܐ ܕܢܝܢ̣ܘܐ. ܐܝܟ ܫܐ̣ܠܬܗ ܕܪܒܢ ܓܘܡܥܐ. ܕܐܠܗܐ ܡܪܐ ܟܠ ܢܚܲܣܐ ܠܟܬܘܒܐ ܘܠܩܲܢܝܐ ܒܬܪ̈ܝܗܘܢ ܥ̈ܠܡܐ ܠܥܠܡܝܢ ܐܡܝܢ.

item.p: A paper leaf, about 9 ¾ in. by 6 5/8.

handNote.desc: It is written in a good hand of the xiiith cent.

item.p: Another note, of later date, which informs us that the volume belonged to a monk named Abraham, who had purchased it from the priest Isaiah.

p.quote: ܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܐܒ̈ܗܬܐ ܠܪܒܢ ܐܒܪܗܡ ܕܝܪܝܐ ܢܟܦܐ ܕܩܢܝ̣ܗܝ ܒܙܒܢܐ ܢܡܘܣܝܐ ܡܢ ܡܐ ܕܙܳܢܰܬ ܠܗ ܛܝܒܘܬܐ ܐܠܗܝܬܐ ܡܢ ܩܫܝܫܐ ܐܫܥܝܐ.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue , abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.
